name: Hampton Inn Orlando-S. Of Universal Studios

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here because we needed to go off in several directions during 4 days. This was a good place near the highways and we visited Cocoa Beach (Shuttle Launch), Mount Dora and Celebration from this location.
reviews.title: Easy access to all of central Florida

reviews.text: As like every other hotel in the Hilton chain we stayed in we enjoyed it and found it pleasant and priced right.
reviews.title: Awesome Value and Friendly Staff!

reviews.text: Didn't get a chance to try out a lot of the amenities but liked the pool area and breakfast area where the staff was extremely nice. Wish it had a self laundry. Did not want to use valet laundry. Followed signs to "guest laundy" but it would not open with my keycard - off limits.
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations

reviews.text: This would be perfect if you want Universal Studios.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: Just stayed here with a large school group (our kids were performing at Magic Kingdom and Universal). The staff couldn't have been more accomodating or helpful...all were friendly and attended to our needs at once....with a special shout out to the night manager, James, who went above and beyond duty when I wanted to stay an extra night with my kids after the school group left. The rooms were CLEAN, no smell (as previously reported), the beds were the most comfortable I've slept in at a hotel, and the free hot breakfast was worth the price of admission. And good coffee!! You won't go wrong if you book this hotel for your Orlando stay. Excellent!
reviews.title: Excelent Choice !

reviews.text: We had a great stay at this hotel. We arrived very late on Friday with our kids. The girl at front desk was super friendly and funny and very efficient. I had read in the reviews about a bad smell, there was absolutely no bad smell in any floors. With two little kids we had to go through the whole place of course. Our room was very clean and it was done every day. If we needed something it was done in that moment, didn't need to wait for anything. We took advantage of the transportation to Disney and were glad to save the money we would have had to pay for parking and gas.
reviews.title: Great stay, Friendly, Very clean

reviews.text: I was happy to see that when the hotel said breakfast time was from 6 am to 10 am they really kept it. The people that came at the last minute to eat still were able to get everything, nothing was running out. All personnel was absolutely helpful and great. I am very happy with the choice of our hotel and will come back again.
reviews.title: Bad smell on 3rd floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They are transforming this hotel into all non smoking. So they are using an awful scent to try and overpower the smokey smell and it was awful. Ask for a floor that has always been non smoking. I normally love staying at the Hampton Inns but this one needed some work. There is a newer one close by but it was booked.
reviews.title: too busy

reviews.text: this hotel used to be a gem mainly business people, this year they seemed to have accepted alot of big group bookings, the pool was overtaken with big groups of screaming yelling kids, if you want peace and quiet do not go here, these group bookings are all very well and good for making money but when they overtake the pool everyday of our stay which was 7 days it was very stressful and noisy. breakfast so busy nowhere to sit not enough seating.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel at a great price

reviews.text: I went to visit my daughter & grandson in FL. We stayed two nights here as we wanted to be in a hotel near Sea World & Universal Studios. This hotel is a little older for Hampton's but still very nice and clean. We loved having breakfast and hot coffee in the morning. It was a special treat to come back in at night and get a cookie too at the desk. Staff friendly and able to give good directions.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Was very pleased with the Hampton Inn. It's just off International Drive (about a 5 min walk to Itrolley stop 7, about 15 mins walk from Wet n Wild). Universal is also within walking distance (takes about 30 mins) but the hotel runs a shuttle every morning to there so only walked it once. They also run several shuttles to Disney each day which is very handy.
reviews.title: Great value hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were basic but spacious enough (there were 3 of us in a double room). The bathroom was very tiny but this didn't bother us. Maid service was excellent! Very friendly and thorough. Loved the choice of soft or firm pillows.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel at a great price!

reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast was great, a good selection and well stocked by the helpful staff. The breakfast room isn't huge but there is a meeting room open aswell for people to eat in and you're welcome to take items to your room. They also provide On the Go bags at reception with a selection of snacks and water to take away with you on days out and cookies in the evening (from around 6pm). Tea and coffee are available in the breakfast area all day which was handy for grabbing a cuppa when coming home exhausted!
reviews.title: Great place near I drive attractions like...

reviews.text: The pool was always very quiet with free loungers and a towel cupboard that was frequently restocked.
reviews.title: Older Hotel with comfortable beds and great service!

reviews.text: Reception were great to deal with, they helped us with directions and booked us taxis. We had to complain about our next door room having a shouting match in the early hours of the morning and the front desk were great about dealing with it quickly. There is also a guest services desk that can help you book tickets for shows and parks and give information on travel services.
reviews.title: total mess

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for two nights to go to Epcot (a 15 minute drive). While our room was small (I believe we got a smaller room because we used a discount coupon), it was comfortable and clean. The doors in the hallways slam very loudly, so if you are a light sleeper, take a noise machine, as the A/C unit is very quiet and controlled via thermostat. The breakfast was one of the best I've ever had, featuring eggs, bacon, hash browns, cereal, pastries, fruit, etc. You won't be disappointed here!
reviews.title: Great value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Those people are very careful with all the details.The room is very spacious, with two comfortable queen beds The breakfast is delicious. The staff is helpful and nice. The room and bathroom were always clean. They have coffe and fruit punch in the lobby area all the time. I certainly would come back to this hotel. They have free wifi and parking. Good place to rest at the end of the day.
reviews.title: Best Hotel ever!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was fall 2008 when we first stayed at a Hampton Inn, in Toledo, OH. Since then my partner and I are staying at hotels within the chain wherever a branch was available in the areas of the US we visited. By this time we have stayed at at least 15 different hotels within the Hampton chain. After experiencing this amount of stays, we blindly are booking new stays at any Hampton branch. We have the idea we know what to expect, after all... However, we are not so sure about that after checking in at Hampton Inn Orlando South of Universal Studios Florida. The property is not worth the name Hampton. We were shocked and extremely disappointed by this property.
reviews.title: Not Hampton worthy. At all...

reviews.text: The property is VERY outdated, in each and every way. The staff is friendly, that's what we recognize from previous stays. That's about it, unfortunately.
reviews.title: Great hotel with a great value!

reviews.text: The over all appearance breathes eighties all over. Not only the exterior, also the interior. The carpets are stale and don't smell nice. It creates a dusty smell in the rooms.
reviews.title: fit our needs

aka: Hampton Inn Orlando-s. Of Universal Studios Hotel
